summary.body: Having entered one of those 5k charity runs (seemed like a good idea at the time....) I am now faced with the unpleasant task of training. finding treadmills terminally dull even with the benefit of pumping tunes in my ears, i have just realised the benefits of the perimeter highwalk (including round by museum of london) as a running route. does anyone know how far this is so i can work out how many laps is the equivalent to 5k?  need to learn to pace to myself before i collapse in a beetroot-faced heap......
summary.subject: How long is the highwalk?

summary.body: Does anyone know when the next St Giles book sale is? I want to donate some books for them to sell.  I can't see anything about it on the St Giles website (although it does have some great photos of the history of the church).
summary.subject: St Giles Book-sale: when is the next one?

summary.body: Further to an earlier post, I am also doing the Race for Life - I've checked the website but can't see if there's a map of the route so I can practice! Has anyone else found one?
summary.subject: Race for Life

summary.body: I'll try this in 'discussion' as in 'classified' I got the lowest number of responses from any posting that I have ever made for UNICEF (NIL).   if you have any left-over or demonitised currency; notes or coins, British or foreign, pre-Euro or whatever; please will you consider donating them to UNICEF for their work with children in the developing world.  (see   )  You can:  `1` give them via an envelope addressed to Graym McMillan and dropped through the letterbox at 201 Gilbert House (Symonds - my partner's name)  `2` donate them on any British Airways flight (see:   )  `3` donate them direct to UNICEF-UK at Africa House (Africa House, 64-78 Kingsway, London, WC2B 6NB)  Thanks for reading and for considering this posting.  Graym McMillan
summary.subject: UNICEF

summary.body: For some crazy reason I am running the London Marathon next April for the Children's Society. I am currently trying to think of new and exciting ways to raise sponsorship money, but I just wondered what everyone thought about 'touting' (excuse the phrase) for sponsorship around the Barbican? I was planning on offering a car washing service, and potentially organising a cake sale, but any other ideas people have (as well as feedback as to the reception of these) would be gratefully received.
summary.subject: Sponsorship Ideas

summary.body: Hi there Normally we live in Defoe House, but this year we decided to rent our flat out and attempt to cycle from the Barbican to Dehli for charity. We are currently in Romania. You can follow our adventure on   John and Sally ps. we are struggling to get a visa for Iran. If anybody has any contacts at the Iranian embassy please drop me a note at
summary.subject: Cycle trip from London to India

summary.body: I am holding an  all day coffeee break in aid of the development charity,  ActionAid on Friday March 10, 10.30-6.   I hope as many neighbours as possible will drop in at some point.  Look forward to seeing you.  Joanna  307 Bunyan Court
summary.subject: ActionAid all day coffee March 10
